metadata.title: CVE-2020-25715 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in pki-core 10.9.0. A specially crafted POST request canbe used to reflect a DOM-based cross-site scripting (XSS) attack to injectcode into the search query form which can get automatically executed. Thehighest threat from this vulnerability is to data integrity.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-25715` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

dogtag-pki - 10.2.6+git20160317-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
dogtag-pki-console-theme - 10.2.6+git20160317-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
dogtag-pki-server-theme - 10.2.6+git20160317-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
libsymkey-java - 10.2.6+git20160317-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
libsymkey-jni - 10.2.6+git20160317-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
pki-base - 10.2.6+git20160317-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
pki-ca - 10.2.6+git20160317-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
pki-console - 10.2.6+git20160317-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
pki-javadoc - 10.2.6+git20160317-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
pki-kra - 10.2.6+git20160317-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
pki-ocsp - 10.2.6+git20160317-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
pki-server - 10.2.6+git20160317-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
pki-tks - 10.2.6+git20160317-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
pki-tools - 10.2.6+git20160317-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
pki-tps - 10.2.6+git20160317-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
pki-tps-client - 10.2.6+git20160317-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: dogtag-pki package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '10.2.6+git20160317-1ubuntu0.1~esm1').
